title: 820-01598 pulsing rails
message:
Hi,

I'm working on a MBP 820-01598 with pulsing rails. All rails up to PMU_ONOFF_L seem to pulse. PMU_ON_OFF_L itself is stable at 3.3V. PPBUS_G3H is cycling from 12.6V to 12.3V. PP3V3_S5 and following rails are steady 0V.
Resistances on big coils seem to be good.
No signs of lliquid on the board. It had some burnt components on PP5V_G3S_ALSCAM that i replaced. Already checked rails for short to grounds but didn't found anything obvious.
Any ideas what's going on here?

Thanks

title: 820-01598 pulsing rails
message: Trackpad is also turning on and off again.

title: 820-01598 pulsing rails
message:
Test the board alone on the desk.
Don't connect any cable; just check voltages and USB activity.

title: 820-01598 pulsing rails
message:
I did checked the voltages when the Board was all allone when I recognized the rails are pulsing. 
Didn't checked USB activity yet.

title: 820-01598 pulsing rails
message:
If power rails are pulsing even on board alone, I doubt you can get USB activity.

Do you have steady 20V on USB-C ports?
All AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages present and stable?
If yes, try DFU...

title: 820-01598 pulsing rails
message:
Yes I'm getting steady 20V on bozh USB-C ports.
Checked only PP1V8_AWAKE (since the other probe points are hidden under the T2 shield next to the SSD and i want to avoid removing it and raflowing the SSD acidentally) and this rail is pulsing too.

title: 820-01598 pulsing rails
message: Took a closer look on PP3v3_G3H and PP5V_G3H. PP3V3_G3H is present and stable. PP5V_G3H is dropping to 4.7V every few seconds, rising up to 5.1V again.

title: 820-01598 pulsing rails
message: And PPBUS_G3H goes from 12.6V to 11.6B to 12.3B back to 12.6V

title: 820-01598 pulsing rails
message:
T2 voltages are available on the U7800 surrounding coils.

Did you try DFU?

title: 820-01598 pulsing rails
message:
I know but unfortunately the shield goes over T2 and U7800 - including the coils.
But I was able to measure PP1V8_SLPS2R and PP1V8_AWAKE on QE000 and QE001.

Yes I did but was not able to enter DFU mode.

title: 820-01598 pulsing rails
message:
Be sure to follow all the steps in the tutorial; use correct USB-C port.
Try with Catalina and Big Sur on second Mac.
If still not recognized, then you have a problem with T2, or some AWAKE, or SLPS2R voltage is missing.

title: 820-01598 pulsing rails
message:
[QUOTE="dudipupan, post: 76229, member: 28284"]
[B]Checked only PP1V8_AWAKE [/B](since the other probe points are hidden under the T2 shield next to the SSD and i want to avoid removing it and raflowing the SSD acidentally) [B]and this rail is pulsing too[/B].
[/QUOTE]
I already know that PP1V8_AWAKE and PP1V8_SLPS2R are missing/pulsing. I dont think the others are stable. Sorry for the badly readable post!

title: 820-01598 pulsing rails
message: Looks like damaged T2...

title: 820-01598 pulsing rails
message:
After many many tries I was able to enter DFU mode. Think it just needed to be perfect timing because of the pulsing rails. 
I revived it but it aborted with error message "Unexpected device state "DFU" expected "Recovery"".
But rails are not pulsing anymore now. Got all rails stable up to PP3v3_S5. All S5 rails are missing.

title: 820-01598 pulsing rails
message:
Try restore instead and reinstall macOS.
Be aware, this will erase internal SSD.
Ask the client if has important data, or security copy done first.

title: 820-01598 pulsing rails
message:
Already asked that - no important data to save on this board :-)
I'm getting the same error message when trying to restore.
It takes constant 0.17 amps now. I can't power it off - it just restarts after a second.

title: 820-01598 pulsing rails
message: Check if you get SSD voltages.

title: 820-01598 pulsing rails
message:
PPVCCQ_ANI_SSD0: 1.8V
PP0V9_SSD0: 0.9V
PP2V5_NAND_SSD0: 2.56V
SSD0_VR_P2V5_PGOOD: 2.5V
SSD0_PMIC_RESET_L: 1.8V

All stable... seem to be good.

title: 820-01598 pulsing rails
message: So, the machine doesn't respond to power button now?

title: 820-01598 pulsing rails
message: It powers off for a second when i hold the power button but immediately powers on again.

title: 820-01598 pulsing rails
message: I retried DFU mode with another power cable for the supply of the (DFU-)macbook. I didn't get a error message yet but it seems to install forever. I will let it install overnight and look what it shows tomorrow.

title: 820-01598 pulsing rails
message:
You've said no S5 power rails present.
That means board is off.
I was expecting to turn on the board pressing power button, not viceversa.

title: 820-01598 pulsing rails
message:
Sorry for my very poor formulation! ? Seems like I was too tired when I wrote my last post. 
I was referring to the DFU mode - there it shows the following behavior: It's always in recovery mode. When I hold power button down it switches off for a sec,coming back to recovery mode.
But no reaction on pressing power button. No pulsing on the s5 rails or anything. Just PM_ONOFF_L going down.

title: 820-01598 pulsing rails
message:
Test the machine in normal mode; see if turns on/off with power button.
Check at least for pulse on the coils.

title: 820-01598 pulsing rails
message:
Thank you very much for your patience and your help! I really aperciate it :-)

No response on power button. 
Trackpad is always an. When i hold power button down the trackpad powers off for a second then back on again - without pressing power button again.

title: 820-01598 pulsing rails
message:

Restore is not possible aswell i get this message after it nearly finishes
